newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Acacia MD sees modest profit improvement.
newsitem.headline: Acacia MD sees modest profit improvement.

text.p: Acacia Resources Ltd's managing director Michael Folie said the gold mining company would do better in 1997 than the previous year, but he said the expected rise in net profit would not be dramatic.
"Not a dramatic (lift).... we think we have hit the bottom, that is the key," he told reporters after the company's annual meeting.
"The important thing is we will do better than the A$14 million (1996 result) in the coming year," he said.
Acacia reported a drop in net profit to A$14.3 million in calendar 1996 from A$22.1 million in 1995.
Folie said the gold price still provided uncertainty while production in the company's Northern Territory operations had been hit in the first quarter of 1997 by poor weather.

However, the company was pleased with early indications from its Sunrise Dam operation in Western Australia, which had now moved into full production and had produced 7,300 ounces of gold at a head grade of 4.1 grams/tonne in its start-up phase, he said.
"Basically, the profit will turn around," he said.
